text: Richard J. DiBiaso (February 6, 1941 – October 19, 2017) was an American college basketball coach for Stanford University. From Monessen, Pennsylvania, DiBiaso played college basketball for coach Bill Gibson at Mansfield State (now Mansfield University of Pennsylvania). Years later, DiBiaso got his college coaching break from Beacon High School in Beacon, New York when Gibson hired him as an assistant at Virginia. In 1971, Digger Phelps added DiBiaso to his first staff at Notre Dame, where he stayed until 1975. in 1975, DiBiaso was named head coach at Stanford. In his first season, DiBiaso took a team that returned one starter and experienced significant injuries to a 9–18 record. Eleven of the losses were by six points are fewer. His efforts were recognized at the end of the season when he was named Pac-8 Conference co- coach of the year with George Raveling. DiBiaso would stay for several more seasons and was given a two-year contract in February 1981. However, he announced he was resigning at the end of the 1981–82 season in February of 1982. DiBiaso died on October 19, 2017 in Auburn, California. He was survived by his wife, Shawna, and children Brian and Shawne. ==References== ==External links== *College record @ sports-reference.com * Category:1941 births Category:2017 deaths Category:American men's basketball coaches Category:American men's basketball players Category:Basketball coaches from Pennsylvania Category:Basketball players from Pennsylvania Category:College men's basketball head coaches in the United States Category:College men's basketball players in the United States Category:High school basketball coaches in New York (state) Category:Mansfield University of Pennsylvania alumni Category:Notre Dame Fighting Irish men's basketball coaches Category:People from Monessen, Pennsylvania Category:Point guards Category:Stanford Cardinal men's basketball coaches Category:Virginia Cavaliers men's basketball coaches
title: Dick DiBiaso
